outcome.title: Surfaces and Graphs
outcome.description: Use traces and contours to describe surfaces in three-space that are graphs of two-variable functions and level sets of three-variable functions, including quadric surfaces.

outcome.title: Vector Arithmetic
outcome.description: Perform and geometrically interpret sums, differences, scalar multiples, and magnitudes of vectors in n-dimensional space.

outcome.title: Vector Geometry
outcome.description: Choose among, and use, dot products and cross products of vectors to compute quantities of geometric interest, including angles and areas.

outcome.title: Parametrized Lines
outcome.description: Determine parametric equations for a line in three-space, given sufficient information to determine a point and a direction vector.

outcome.title: Planes
outcome.description: Determine a level set equation for a plane in three-space defined either by a point and a normal vector, or by three given non-collinear points.

outcome.title: Partial Derivative Computations
outcome.description: Compute the partial derivatives of a given multivariable function, up to second order.

outcome.title: Tangent Planes
outcome.description: Find equations for tangent planes to surfaces expressed as graphs of two-variable functions and as level sets of three-variable functions.

outcome.title: The Gradient of f(x,y)
outcome.description: Compute the gradient vector of a two-variable function, give its geometric interpretation with respect both to the contours of the function and to its graph, and use it to calculate directional derivatives in a given direction.

outcome.title: Critical Points of Multivariable Functions
outcome.description: Use its gradient vector to locate critical points of a multivariable function, and its second-order partial derivatives to classify critical points as local maximum, local minimum, saddle points, or degenerate.
